CatDescriptText: Artist Henry Ossawa Tanner (1859-1937) was born in Pittsburgh, studied at the Philadelphia Academy of Fine Arts, and settled in Paris.  He painted "Christ and His Mother" in 1910.  Edgar J. Kaufmann donated the painting to the Y.M.C.A. in 1941.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of ten women, some wearing furs and hats, including Dora Notes standing on left and salon owner Gloria Golden Grate second from right at the Beauty Shop Owners Association Annual Fashion Show, posed beneath Henry O. Tanner painting of Christ and His Mother at the Centre Avenue YMCA
